greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of elements in GL(2,Z_n) x with x^2 == I mod n where I is the identity matrix.
comment: a(n) is multiplicative and for an odd prime power p^k : a(p^k) = 2 + p^(2k-1)(p+1). [corrected by _Felix A. Pahl_, Mar 08 2013]
Number of involutory matrices mod n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 29 2013
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(o=valuation(n,2),f=factor(n>>o)); prod(i=1,#f[,1],f[i,1]^(2*f[i,2])+f[i,1]^(2*f[i,2]-1)+2)*if(o, if(o>1, if(o>2, 9*4^(o-1)+32,28),4),1) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 29 2013
results.author: Sharon Sela (sharonsela(AT)hotmail.com), Jan 26 2002
ext: Added more terms (from A066947), _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 08 2013
